Package it.unicam.cs.pa.robot

Interface RobotLoopManagement

All Known Subinterfaces:
Robot
All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicRobot
public interface RobotLoopManagement
The RobotLoopManagement interface defines methods for managing robot loop commands and execution. This interface allows to manage robot commands and also gives the possibility of managing nested loops.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    currentCommandIndex()
    Gets the current index of the command being executed by the robot.
    void
    decreaseLoopCount()
    Decreases the loop count by one.
    void
    increaseCurrentCommandIndex()
    Increases the current command index by one.
    void
    pushLoopCount(int count, int index)
    Pushes the loop count and the index where the loop starts to the loop stack.
    void
    pushStartingLoopIndex(int index)
    Pushes the starting index of a loop to the loop stack.
    void
    resetLoopIndex()
    Resets the loop index to the starting index of the current loop iteration.
    void
    setFinishLoopIndex()
    Sets the index indicating the end of a loop execution.

  • Method Details

    • currentCommandIndex

      int currentCommandIndex()
      Gets the current index of the command being executed by the robot.
      Returns:
      The current command index.

    • increaseCurrentCommandIndex

      void increaseCurrentCommandIndex()
      Increases the current command index by one.

    • setFinishLoopIndex

      void setFinishLoopIndex()
      Sets the index indicating the end of a loop execution.

    • pushStartingLoopIndex

      void pushStartingLoopIndex(int index)
      Pushes the starting index of a loop to the loop stack.
      Parameters:
      index - The starting index of the loop.

    • pushLoopCount

      void pushLoopCount(int count, int index)
      Pushes the loop count and the index where the loop starts to the loop stack.
      Parameters:
      count - The remaining iterations of the loop.
      index - The index where the loop starts.

    • decreaseLoopCount

      void decreaseLoopCount()
      Decreases the loop count by one.

    • resetLoopIndex

      void resetLoopIndex()
      Resets the loop index to the starting index of the current loop iteration.
